intro: Rutidochlamys mitchellii, commonly known as Mitchell's rock fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Moraceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Australia, particularly in Western Australia and South Australia. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is well adapted to harsh environments, with a deep root system that allows it to survive in dry conditions. The fruit, which is a small, smooth, greenish-yellow berry, is edible and has a sweet, fig-like flavor.
